intro: Morilloa, commonly known as the "Mexican morning glory," is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many vines and flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to purple, often with a distinct scent. Morilloa typically grows as a climbing vine, with heart-shaped leaves and tendrils that help it ascend supports. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening in warm climates.
